com.googlecode.prmf.merapi.net
Class SocketClient

java.lang.Object
  com.googlecode.prmf.merapi.net.SocketClient
Direct Known Subclasses:
LineOrientedClient
public abstract class SocketClient
extends Object

An event-driven, non-blocking client socket manager.

The typical use of a client is:

  1. Construct the client.
  2. Register listeners with the client.
  3. Start the client.
Note that this is not sufficient for complete functioning because the client is non-blocking: the connect(), read(), and write() need to be called to perform I/O operations. The best way to accomplish this is using a Selector: the client sets itself as attachment when registering with a Registrar, so the I/O methods can be called when the selection key is connectable, readable, or writable, respectively.

This class is abstract to allow for different types of messages. Subclasses must implement scanBuffer(StringBuilder) to define message parsing. They should probably also define delegates to the protected send(CharSequence) to allow sending messages, as well as custom, protocol-specific events (because the network ones are likely too general).

Author:
Miorel-Lucian Palii
See Also:
SocketClientsThread

Constructor Detail

SocketClient

public SocketClient(SocketAddress address,
                    Registrar registrar)
Builds a client that will connect to the specified address, register with the specified registrar, and use a default provider to open channels.

Parameters:
address - the address to connect to
registrar - the registrar which will dictate network activity

SocketClient

public SocketClient(SocketAddress address,
                    Registrar registrar,
                    SelectorProvider provider)
Builds a client that will connect to the specified address, register with the specified registrar, and use the specified provider to open channels.

Parameters:
address - the address to connect to
registrar - the registrar which will dictate network activity
provider - the provider to use for opening channels, or null to use the default provider
Method Detail

getAddress

public SocketAddress getAddress()
Returns this client's address.

Returns:
this client's address

start

public void start()
           throws IOException
Starts this client's connection process. If the client was already connected or connecting, it will be stop()-ed first.

Throws:
IOException - if an I/O error occurs

connect

public void connect()
             throws IOException
Tells this client to attempt finishing the process of connecting. Users should not invoke this directly, but let the registrar do so when the socket is ready for connecting. If you're looking for the method that starts the client's connection process, it's called start().

Throws:
IOException - if an I/O error occurs

stop

public void stop()
Stops (disconnects) this client. The underlying socket is closed and its channel deregistered. Network event listeners will be notified of the disconnection.

report

protected void report(Throwable t)
Defines how this client reports exceptions or other Throwables. The default is to print a stack trace to the standard error stream.

Parameters:
t - the Throwable to report

read

public void read()
          throws IOException
Tells this client to attempt reading a message from its incoming buffer. Users should not invoke this directly, but let the registrar do so when the socket is ready for reading.

Throws:
IOException - if an I/O error occurs

write

public void write()
           throws IOException
Tells this client to attempt writing a message from its outgoing queue to the underlying socket. Users should not invoke this directly, but let the registrar do so when the socket is ready for writing.

Throws:
IOException - if an I/O error occurs

scanBuffer

protected abstract void scanBuffer(StringBuilder buffer)
Defines how this client scans messages from its incoming buffer. Implementations should discard characters from the beginning of the buffer when a message is successfully read, but should not otherwise modify the contents of the buffer. Read messages should be announced by raising a reading event.

Parameters:
buffer - a reference to this client's incoming buffer

send

protected void send(CharSequence message)
Queues a literal message in this client's outgoing queue.

Parameters:
message - the messages to queue

addNetworkEventListener

public void addNetworkEventListener(NetworkEventListener listener)
Adds a network listener to this client's listener set.

Parameters:
listener - the listener to add

distributeNetworkEvent

protected void distributeNetworkEvent(NetworkEvent event)
Distributes a network event to the network listeners registered with this client.

Parameters:
event - the event to distribute

removeNetworkEventListener

public void removeNetworkEventListener(NetworkEventListener listener)
Removes a network listener from this client's listener set.

Parameters:
listener - the listener to remove

raiseReadingEvent

protected void raiseReadingEvent(String message)
Raises a reading event with the specified message. This should be used by subclasses in their implementation of scanBuffer(StringBuilder) in order to notify listeners.

Parameters:
message - the message of the reading event

raiseWritingEvent

protected void raiseWritingEvent(String message)
Raises a writing event with the specified message. This is called to notify listeners when the write actually happens (since it might not immediately after the message gets queued).

Parameters:
message - the message of the writing event
